intro: Lappula tadshikorum, commonly known as the Tadshik Tasselplant, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along riverbanks. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered with a fine layer of wax, which helps reduce water loss. Lappula tadshikorum is also notable for its seed production, with small, dry fruits that disperse easily in the wind.
